thread.title: Google doodle celebrates late Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan’s 67th birthday
thread.title_full: Google doodle celebrates late Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan’s 67th birthday | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Google doodle celebrates late Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan’s 67th birthday
text:
Other Articles Selena Gomez slams Taylor Swift, Calvin Harris' 'stupid' split rumours Vin Diesel silences body-shamers via 'six-pack-abs' pic Major breakthrough as bowel cancer classified into four distinct groups The latest Google doodle has marked late legendary Pakistani musician Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan’s 67th birthday on its homepage with an animation.
Google users can see the doodle about the late ‘Afreen Afreen’ singer as an animated picture on the Google logo, where he is sitting and singing a ‘qawwali’ while his team members are playing musical instruments.
Born in the year 1948, Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan, nicknamed the Shahenshah-e-Qawwali, passed away at a very early age of 48 due to a cardiac arrest on August 16, 1997.
Carrying forward the 600-year-old tradition of ‘qawwali’ in his family, he is known for his long hour performances and bringing the magic of ‘qawwali’ music to international audience.
The Google doodle is a timely reminder of the old traditional music in the face of the onslaught by the modern ‘loud’ variety that is full of innuendo.
 13, 2015 8:34 am
